results.title: Working Without a Contract, Yankees G.M. Has a Long Shopping List
results.abstract: Aaron Judge’s free agency looms over everything at the general managers’ meetings, but Brian Cashman says he has other holes to fill. Cashman’s own deal will have to wait.

multimedia.caption: Aaron Judge turned down a $213.5 million contract extension last off-season. He reached free agency after a season in which he set an American League single-season record with 62 home runs.
multimedia.copyright: Nathan Hunsinger for The New York Times

results.title: Nets Name Jacque Vaughn as Head Coach
results.abstract: Vaughn, an assistant coach, had been filling in since the team fired Steve Nash last week. Guard Kyrie Irving, who promoted an antisemitic movie on Twitter, remains suspended.

multimedia.caption: Jacque Vaughn has been on the Nets’ coaching staff since 2016.
Jacque Vaughn has been on the Nets’ coaching staff since 2016.
Jacque Vaughn has been on the Nets’ coaching staff since 2016.

results.title: A Midseason Look at Who Could Win M.V.P. and Other N.F.L. Awards
results.abstract: It seems almost certain that Aaron Rodgers won’t win his fifth Most Valuable Player Award, a race in which Patrick Mahomes is fast making up ground on Josh Allen.

multimedia.caption: Josh Allen hurt the elbow in his throwing arm in the Bills’ upset loss to the Jets on Sunday.
Josh Allen hurt the elbow in his throwing arm in the Bills’ upset loss to the Jets on Sunday.

results.title: U.S. Roster Could Be World Cup’s Youngest Team
results.abstract: On Wednesday, Coach Gregg Berhalter will name the 26-player roster for the U.S. men’s national soccer team’s long-anticipated return to the World Cup.
org_facet: United States Men's National Soccer Team

results.title: Why Correspondence Chess Is Still Popular Among Elite Players
results.abstract: Players can take days or even weeks to take a turn, and they have embraced the use of software to find the best moves.

multimedia.caption: Today, Correspondence chess games are typically played online. In the past they were played by teletype or postal mail.
Today, Correspondence chess games are typically played online. In the past they were played by teletype or postal mail.

results.title: Brittney Griner Is Being Moved to a Penal Colony, but Her Lawyers Don’t Know Where
results.abstract: The basketball player’s case has become part of a geopolitical struggle between Russia and the United States.

multimedia.caption: Brittney Griner being escorted to the courtroom during her trial in August in Khimki, Russia.
Brittney Griner being escorted to the courtroom during her trial in August in Khimki, Russia.

results.title: Scientists Say Concussions Can Cause a Brain Disease. These Doctors Disagree.
results.abstract: As another major medical institution acknowledged the link between concussions and the brain disease C.T.E., a group of scientists who guide many of sports’ top governing organizations dismissed the research at its conference.

multimedia.caption: Of the nearly 7,500 recent research papers on concussions, scientists considered just 26 as they prepared to write their recommendations on brain injuries in collision sports.

results.title: Running Officials Did Not Test Long-Shot New York City Marathon Winner Before Race
results.abstract: Sharon Lokedi won Sunday’s marathon in her debut at the distance. Because she was little known, she was not subjected to the prerace drug testing program.

results.title: New Endorsements for College Athletes Resurface an Old Concern: Sex Sells
results.abstract: Female college athletes are making millions thanks to their large social media followings. But some who have fought for equity in women’s sports worry that their brand building is regressive.

multimedia.caption: Olivia Dunne, a gymnast at Louisiana State, earns over $1 million annually in endorsements. “That is something I’m proud of,” she said, adding that most female athletes will not advance to a pro league after college.
multimedia.copyright: Annie Flanagan for The New York Times

results.title: Colts Owner Defends Hiring Coach With No N.F.L. Experience
results.abstract: Jeff Saturday, most recently an ESPN analyst, was tabbed as the team’s interim head coach, having coached only high school football.
results.byline: By Victor Mather and Emmanuel Morgan

multimedia.caption: Jeff Saturday, a former center for the Colts, was named interim coach of the team on Monday. His coaching experience is only at the high school level — at Hebron Christian Academy, a high school in Dacula, Ga., where his record was 20-16.

Jeff Saturday, a former center for the Colts, was named interim coach of the team on Monday. His coaching experience is only at the high school level — at Hebron Christian Academy, a high school in Dacula, Ga., where his record was 20-16.

results.title: A Soccer Team Once United Iran. Now It Reflects Its Divisions.
results.abstract: Team Melli was long seen as a unifying force in a fractious nation. As it heads to the World Cup, it has become ensnared in its country’s internal politics.
results.byline: By Jeré Longman and Farnaz Fassihi

multimedia.caption: Iran’s national soccer team, known as Team Melli, before a friendly against Uruguay in September.

results.title: A Surprising WTA Finals Victory Mirrors the Year in Women’s Tennis
results.abstract: Caroline Garcia, ranked just 79th in May, won the season-ending championship and will finish at No. 4 in a year that saw Serena Williams and Ashleigh Barty retire.

multimedia.caption: Caroline Garcia of France after defeating Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus to win the WTA Finals women’s singles final.
Caroline Garcia of France after defeating Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus to win the WTA Finals women’s singles final.

results.title: A $102 Million Closer? It Could Pay Off in October.
results.abstract: Steven A. Cohen and the Mets are on the verge of completing an eye-popping deal with the right-hander Edwin Díaz that will be the largest contract for a reliever in baseball history.

results.title: WTA Chief Talks Money, China and Why Tennis Needs More Female Coaches
results.abstract: Even without China’s “zero-Covid” policy, Steve Simon said that unresolved concerns about Peng Shuai would keep women’s tennis away from Shenzhen and a lucrative 10-year-deal to stage the Finals.

multimedia.caption: “We’re not going to compromise our principles,” Steve Simon, WTA chairman and chief executive, said about the continuing suspension of tournaments in China.
“We’re not going to compromise our principles,” Steve Simon, WTA chairman and chief executive, said about the continuing suspension of tournaments in China.

results.title: Liverpool F.C., One of Soccer’s Biggest Brands, Is for Sale
results.abstract: Months after its Premier League rival Chelsea traded hands in a deal worth $3 billion, Liverpool’s owners hired bankers and said they would entertain offers for the club.

multimedia.caption: Liverpool’s ownership has always said it would listen to offers from investors. Now it is prepared to sell its entire stake.
Liverpool’s ownership has always said it would listen to offers from investors. Now it is prepared to sell its entire stake.

results.title: Tom Brady Has Passed for 100,000 Yards. Sort Of.
results.abstract: The Buccaneers quarterback reached a career milestone only by adding in his postseason totals to his regular-season mark. But no rival can match him on either list.

multimedia.caption: Tampa Bay’s stadium announcement of Tom Brady’s milestone came with some fine print.

results.title: 26.2 Miles Is Easy. Getting Around New York City Is Not.
results.abstract: Daniel Romanchuk, 24, placed second in the New York City Marathon on Sunday. But getting around the city in a wheelchair can be more challenging than the race itself.
results.byline: By Talya Minsberg and Clark Hodgin

results.title: 40 Chickens in 40 Days: How a Philadelphia Man Cheered His City
results.abstract: Alexander Tominsky was on an epic quest to give Philadelphia something to celebrate, but he said he felt relieved to be done with the challenge. “My body is ready to repair,” he said.

multimedia.caption: Alexander Tominsky took on a self-imposed challenge to eat 40 chickens in 40 days. He appeared less than cheerful while consuming one last week.

results.title: Can North Carolina Finish the Job? Or Will the Big Ten Break Through?
results.abstract: The Tar Heels are ranked No. 1 after losing last season’s final to Kansas. And Gonzaga figures to be a contender again with Drew Timme among the star big men who’ve returned to college.

multimedia.caption: Gonzaga has had N.B.A. talent like Jalen Suggs, Corey Kispert and Chet Holmgren come and go. Drew Timme, right, is still here, and still trying to lead the Zags to their first title.

results.title: Bruins Reverse Course on Signing Player Who Racially Abused Classmate
results.abstract: Boston’s president said the team thought Mitchell Miller’s bullying, which led to a juvenile-court conviction, was an isolated incident but decided not to move forward based on new information.

multimedia.caption: “We owe it to our fans, players, staff, partners and community to make sure that our practices and protocols are in keeping with the ethos that we demand from ourselves and as an organization,” Bruins President Cam Neely said.

“We owe it to our fans, players, staff, partners and community to make sure that our practices and protocols are in keeping with the ethos that we demand from ourselves and as an organization,” Bruins President Cam Neely said.
